definition: to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country

sentences.english: Many women felt the keen tug of patriotism.
sentences.chinese: 許多女人渴望精忠報國。

sentences.english: Understanding historic mission, Embodying life value and Repaying motherland by industries.
sentences.chinese: 認清歷史使命，體現人生價值，謀求產業報國。

sentences.english: Only loyalty can serve the country, no more land for home.
sentences.chinese: 只有精忠能報國，更無樂土可爲家。

sentences.english: The spirit of the modern scientist patriotically serves the country was worth us studying.
sentences.chinese: 近代科學家愛國報國的精神值得我們學習。

sentences.english: The sender may use whatever language permitted by the country of destination.
sentences.chinese: 發報人可以用收報國準用的任何語言。

sentences.english: The holiday embodies the story of love and service for one's country.
sentences.chinese: 端午節講述了一個愛國報國的故事。

sentences.english: As a soldier should know about patriotism, obedience.
sentences.chinese: 作爲軍人應該知道精忠報國，服從命令。

sentences.english: Close to the country Taibai night vision light, die without a battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 夜視太白收光芒，報國欲死無戰場。

sentences.english: I've aspired to join the army to serve my country ever since childhood.
sentences.chinese: 我從小就立下了投軍報國的志向。

definition: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to take revenge for a past insult/to expunge a disgrace or humiliation
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
unity of will is an impregnable stronghold (idiom)
